attributes.text: The model structure representing the root of the tree, for more details have a look at the ‘model’ property.
The name of the label property, for more details have a look at the ‘labelPath’ property.
The name of the child property, for more details have a look at the ‘childProperty’ property.
the name of the model property which represents the open state of a branch. If this value is provided, so, too, must be rootModel.
Fired on change of the property {@link #delegate}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #model}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #openMode}.
Fired when a node is closed.
Fired when a node is opened.
Helper method to apply model changes. Normally build the lookup table and apply the default selection.
Item to build parent chain.
Builds the parent chain form the passed item.
The start node to start search.
The nested level from the start node.
Helper method to get all visible children form the passed parent node. The algorithm implements a depth-first search with a complexity: O(n) and n are all visible items.
All visible children form the parent.
Return the first visible parent node from the last selected node.
The first visible node.
Node to set to open nodes.
Helper method to set the node to the open nodes data structure when it is not included.
Start (root) node to search.
Target node to open (and his parents).
Helper method to set the target node and all his parents to the open nodes data structure. The algorithm implements a depth-first search with a complexity: O(n) and n are all model items.
True when the targetNode and his parents could opened, false otherwise.
Helper method to update the row count.
Hook method which is called from the {@link qx.ui.virtual.selection.MModel}. The hook method builds the parent chain form the current selected item.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property childProperty.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #childProperty}.

Applies changes of the property value of the property showTopLevelOpenCloseIcons.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #showTopLevelOpenCloseIcons}.
The newSelection which will be set to the selection manager.

Hook method which is called from the {@link qx.ui.virtual.selection.MModel}. The hook method sets the first visible parent not as new selection when the current selection is empty and the selection mode is one selection.
Returns the element, to which the content padding should be applied.
The content padding target.
row to get data for.
Returns the model data for the given row.
the row’s model data.
Returns the selectable model items.
The selectable items.
Initializes the virtual tree.
Initializes the virtual tree layer.
The data event.
Event handler for the changeBubble event. The handler rebuild the lookup table when the child structure changed.
key event.
Event handler for key press events. Open and close the current selected item on key left and right press. Jump to parent on key left if already closed.
The cell tap event.
Event handler to open/close tapped nodes.
The event.
Event handler for the update event.
The index to look at.
Performs a lookup from model index to row.
The row or -1 if the index is not a model index.
Helper method to build the internal data structure.

Node or leaf to get parent.
Helper method to get the parent node. Node! This only works with leaf and nodes which are in the internal lookup table.
The parent note or null when no parent found.

Initial value for property childProperty.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property childProperty with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #childProperty}.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property hideRoot equals true.

Whether the property equals true.
Node to open.
Opens the passed node and all his parents. Note! The algorithm implements a depth-first search with a complexity: O(n) and n are all model items.
The name of the open property, which determines the open state of a branch in the tree. If null, turn off opening and closing branches via changes to the model.
Open and close branches via changes to a property in the model.
Trigger a rebuild from the internal data structure.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #childProperty}.

The name of the property, where the children are stored in the model. Instead of the {@link #labelPath} must the child property a direct property form the model instance.
Delegation object, which can have one or more functions defined by the {@link qx.ui.tree.core.IVirtualTreeDelegate} interface.
Hides only the root node, not the node’s children when the property is set to true.
A map containing the options for the icon binding. The possible keys can be found in the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding} documentation.
The path to the property which holds the information that should be shown as an icon.
Default item height.
A map containing the options for the label binding. The possible keys can be found in the {@link qx.data.SingleValueBinding} documentation.
The name of the property, where the value for the tree folders label is stored in the model classes.
The model containing the data (nodes and/or leafs) which should be shown in the tree.
Control whether tap or double tap should open or close the tapped item.
Configures the tree to show also the leafs. When the property is set to false only the nodes are shown.
Whether top level items should have an open/close button. The top level item item is normally the root item, but when the root is hidden, the root children are the top level items.
